text:
It’s Transport Day at #COP26

Road transport accounts for 17% of global emissions, and its emissions are rising faster than other sectors. 

We need to speed up our move to zero emission vehicles.

Read more from @UNFCCC 👉 https://t.co/4p0V7TeOGm

#COP26

text:
📢 NEWS: #COP26 is consigning coal to history

✅ 23 countries are making new commitments to phase out coal power, including 5 of the world's top 20 coal power generators.

✅ Planned new coal generation pipeline globally has fallen by 76% since the Paris Agreement in 2015.

author.profile_bio.description: Official Twitter account of the UK #COP26 Presidency. This account is no longer active. Read about our Presidency outcomes 👇

❌Destroy the lives and futures of children and young people by carrying on as usual

Time is running out.

text:
The UK supports #biodiversity programmes like the Forest Carbon Partnership Facility 
 
Through this Costa Rica has received $16.4m for reducing CO2 emissions by 3.28m tonnes 🌳
 
That's equivalent to removing 1.4 million cars from UK roads for a year 🚗
 
Learn more 👇
 
#COP27
author.name: COP26
author.profile_bio.description: Official Twitter account of the UK #COP26 Presidency. This account is no longer active. Read about our Presidency outcomes 👇
explanation: Tweet discusses financial support for biodiversity programs and mentions CO2 emissions reduction, aligning with Finance and Climate Crisis categories. No bio provided, categorization based on tweet content.

text:
Fact: By 2050, every child on earth – just over 2 billion children – is forecast to face frequent heatwaves. 

World leaders must urgently protect children from climate devastation by adapting the services they rely on such as water, health, nutrition and education. #COP27 https://t.co/7m7gxquq9J
author.name: UNICEF
author.profile_bio.description: UNICEF works in over 190 countries and territories to protect children's rights. We won't stop, #ForEveryChild.
explanation: Tweet emphasizes urgent action to protect children from climate impacts, aligning with Emergency Measures and mentioning specific threats under Climate Crisis; UNICEF's focus on child protection supports these categories.
